page.title: 01GAZETEER FOR ABINGDON
page.content: Abingdon is an ancient market town. Formerly the county town of Berkshire but now a thriving satallite town in Oxfordshire. The block surveyed for this project covered central and southern Abingdon,two distinct areas.The central area being the ancient town and modern shopping precinct,and the southern area comprising two large housing estates both predoninantly council owned.The River Thames cuts the block in half.The west side being the town and the other agricultural and Culham village. The survey was carried out by 10 and 11 year old children from Thameside Junior School with Mr A.J.Walkey.The following texts include accounts of ancient buildings and customs and their importance today,also,the childrens views on their homes, famlies and lives in 1985.
